title: Asynchronous Byzantine Fault Tolerance
synopsis:
There is a category of consensus algorithms in the academic literature that we refer to as pure “voting-based” algorithms. They have fantastic security properties – they achieve the gold standard of security in this world of distributed systems, reaching what we call asynchronous Byzantine Fault Tolerance (aBFT).
[https://www.hiddenforcespod.com/hashgraph-consensus-algorithm/ -Transcript of talk] from [[The Future is Not Blockchain]] event.

title: DLT Background
synopsis: Who enforces property rights, the citizen or the state? What is property?

title: EOS
synopsis: The blockchain operating system for commercial scale decentralized applications.

title: Equihash
synopsis: An ASIC-resistant (asymmetric proof-of-work) algorithm that is memory-hard (but easy to verify) may re-decentralize the mining of cryptocurrencies.

title: Fedwiki Tools
synopsis: Here we list a few tools that are of particular use in managing and creating [[Fedwiki]] content. Check [[Recycled pages]] to find delted pages.

title: Hashgraph
synopsis: Distributed Ledger Technology has evolved from Bitcoin to Bitcoin-plus-addons to [[Smart Contracts]] to an entire market ecosystem which tries to address all aspects of game theory. Hashgraph is arguably a 3rd/4th generation of technology which overcomes some of the 1st and 2nd generation limitations.

title: List Blank Entries
synopsis: This is part of my research for the (FedWiki) [[Onboarding Tool]], which uses the techniques of [[Completivity]]

title: Matrix.org
synopsis: Matrix is an open standard for inter-operable communication. It links together messaging networks. It is completely decentralised.

title: Recent Changes
synopsis: Here we list neighborhood pages with those most recently changed listed first. See also [[Local Changes]].

title: The Future is Not Blockchain
synopsis: A transcript and audio is available from this panel [https://www.hiddenforcespod.com/hashgraph-consensus-algorithm/ hiddensforcespod.com]

title: Welcome Visitors
synopsis: [[Andrew Orford]] make notes on [[Blockchain]] technologies and any other related innovations in computer science.
